pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.1: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing acknowledgment
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:4.1: 1. The training rule on asking for ghee
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:5.1: Venerables, these eight rules on offenses entailing acknowledgment come up for recitation.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:6.3: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:6.4: At that time the nuns from the group of six ate ghee after asking for it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:6.6: “How can nuns eat ghee after asking for it?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:6.7: Who doesn’t like nice food? Who doesn’t want tasty food?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:7.1: The nuns heard the complaints of those people.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:7.2: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:7.3: “How can the nuns from the group of six eat ghee after asking for it?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:7.7: How can the nuns from the group of six eat ghee after asking for it?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:7.9: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:8.2: ‘If a nun asks for ghee and then eats it, she must acknowledge it:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:8.3: “I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing which is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.”’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:9.1: In this way the Master laid down this training rule for the nuns.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:10.2: Soon afterwards a number of nuns were sick.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:10.3: The nuns who were looking after them asked,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:10.4: “We hope you’re bearing up; we hope you’re getting better?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:10.5: “Previously we ate ghee after asking for it, and then we were comfortable.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:10.6: But now that this has been prohibited by the Master, we don’t ask because we’re afraid of wrongdoing. And because of that we’re not comfortable.” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:10.8: “Monks, I allow a sick nun to eat ghee after asking for it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:10.9: And so, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:11.1: ‘If a nun who is not sick asks for ghee and then eats it, she must acknowledge it:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:11.2: “I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing which is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.”’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:12.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:13.2: one who is comfortable without ghee.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:14.2: one who is not comfortable without ghee.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:15.2: ghee from cows, ghee from goats, ghee from buffaloes, or ghee from whatever animal whose meat is allowable.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:16.1: If she is not sick and she asks for her own benefit, then the effort constitutes wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:16.2: When she receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:16.3: For every mouthful, she commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:17.1: If she is not sick, and she does not perceive herself as sick, and she eats ghee after asking for it, she commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:17.2: If she is not sick, but she is unsure of it, and she eats ghee after asking for it, she commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:17.3: If she is not sick, but she perceives herself as sick, and she eats ghee after asking for it, she commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:18.1: If she is sick, but she does not perceive herself as sick, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:18.2: If she is sick, but she is unsure if she is, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:18.3: If she is sick, and she perceives herself as sick, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:19.3: if she asked for it when she was sick, but eats it when she is no longer sick;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:19.4: if she eats the leftovers from one who is sick;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:19.6: if it is from those who have given an invitation;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:19.7: if it is for the benefit of someone else;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:19.8: if it is by means of her own property;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:19.10: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:20.1: The first training rule entailing acknowledgment is finished.
